basics.name: Xiangjian Zeng
basics.label: Graduate Student
basics.summary: Graduate student at Massachusetts Institute of Technology researching cognitive basis of the brain with computational modeling and creating functional neuromodulation systems with engineering toolsets

work.name: Lewis Lab, Massachusetts Institute of Technology
work.summary: Design algorithms to use auditory stimulation to promote cerebrospinal fluid circulation during sleep to enhance waste clearance

work.name: Insanally Lab, University of Pittsburgh
work.summary: Developed ensemble decoder in Python incorporating information from multiple neurons to predict mouse behavior in auditory discrimination tasks

work.name: Chamanzar Lab, Carnegie Mellon University
work.summary: Created neural optical probe characterization system based on light scattering, incorporating robotics, computer vision, and signal processing

work.name: Lerman Lab, UC San Diego
work.summary: Led research and implementation of adaptive filtering algorithm to eliminate powerline noise contaminating peripheral nerve recordings

volunteer.summary: Presented poster on contributions and synaptic basis of diverse cortical neuron response to flexible task performance

awards.title: Magna Cum Laude
awards.summary: Graduated with highest honors from UC San Diego with a Bachelor's degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering

publications.name: Automated Photonic Waveguide Loss Measurement using Out-scattering Light Method
publications.publisher: Integrated Systems Design and Technology Conference 2023
publications.summary: First author publication on automated photonic waveguide characterization system based on light scattering method

publications.name: Dynamic gating of perceptual flexibility by non-classically responsive neurons
publications.summary: Co-authored manuscript revealing the significance of non-classically-response neurons in task learning through Bayesian ensemble neural decoding

publications.name: Contributions and synaptic basis of diverse cortical neuron response to flexible task performance
publications.summary: First author poster presentation on cortical neuron responses to flexible task performance

publications.name: RLS Harmonic Powerline Noise Cancellation in Radial Nerve Recording
publications.summary: First author conference paper on adaptive filtering algorithm for noise cancellation in peripheral nerve recordings
